subject: Politics
title: The Belt and Road Initiative
description: A fast breakdown of The Belt and Road Initiative for builders.

hook.text: China is building ports, railways, and highways across 140 countries. It's the largest infrastructure project ever.

buildup.text: The Belt and Road Initiative connects Asia, Africa, and Europe through Chinese-funded infrastructure projects.

discovery.text: China lends billions for roads and ports. Critics call it 'debt-trap diplomacy' â€” loans that create dependency.

twist.text: Sri Lanka defaulted on a Chinese loan and handed over a port for 99 years. The debt trap became real.

climax.text: The US and EU launched rival initiatives. But China's head start and spending power are hard to match.

punchline.text: China builds roads to build influence. Infrastructure is the new imperialism.

quiz.question: What happened when Sri Lanka couldn't repay its Chinese loan?
options: It handed over a strategic port to China for 99 years
The UN intervened to renegotiate terms
